borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposal, by reason of siting, mass, scale and design, would be an undesirable addition which would reduce the outdoor amenity space to an unacceptable level. As such, it fails to protect residential amenity, having a harmful impact on the amenity of current and future occupiers. The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure development proposals protect residential amenity:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies&nbsp;BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.2&nbsp;and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<p>The proposal, by reason of siting, mass, scale, bulk and design, would be an undesirable addition which would disrupt the symmetry of the terrace row, would not appear subservient to the original dwelling, would remove the openness of the corner plot on which it is sited and which constitutes overdevelopment of the site. As such, it fails to respect or reflect the character of the original dwelling, the terrace row of which it forms a part, and the surrounding area, causing harm to each of these as well as to the street scene along both Park Drive and Fels Farm Avenue.&nbsp;The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure development proposals are well designed, respect and reflect the existing character:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy&nbsp;D4&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</p><p>Policies&nbsp;BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.1 and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies SP2 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>
description: Construction of two storey side extension
